docs.lead_paragraph: Doulas assist, assure, educate and advocate on behalf of pregnant women, but because of resistance from the medical profession and lack of insurance reimbursement, they are still a small part of the system.

headline.main: Doulas, a Growing Force in Maternity Culture, Seek Greater Acceptance
headline.print_headline: Doulas, a Growing Force in Maternity Culture, Seek Greater Acceptance

docs.abstract: Doulas, professionals who provide emotional and logistical support for women in childbirth process, are small but growing presence in New York City; do not need license to practice and many hospitals do not recognize them as part of medical team; have begun organizing into formal networks and are attempting to get their services covered by medical insurance providers.
docs.snippet: Doulas assist, assure, educate and advocate on behalf of pregnant women, but because of resistance from the medical profession and lack of insurance reimbursement, they are still a small part of the system.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dietary advice can be confusing. Is it OK to eat meat and eggs? Is fat in or out? What about grains? How much salt?

headline.main: News Guide: Dietary Guidelines Evolve, Stay the Same
headline.print_headline: News Guide: Dietary Guidelines Evolve, Stay the Same

docs.snippet: Dietary advice can be confusing. Is it OK to eat meat and eggs? Is fat in or out? What about grains? How much salt?

docs.lead_paragraph: Kraft Foods says it will start sweetening its Capri Sun drinks with sugar instead of high-fructose corn syrup.

headline.main: Kraft's Capri Sun to Drop High-Fructose Corn Syrup

docs.lead_paragraph: Texas rancher Jim Rackley would like to add more cattle to his herd of about 50 to take advantage of sizzling beef prices and growing demand from health-conscious consumers for his grass-fed beef. But the prospect of cloudless skies keeps him cautious.

headline.main: Weather Worries U.S. Cattle Producers as They Slowly Expand Herds
headline.print_headline: Weather Worries U.S. Cattle Producers as They Slowly Expand Herds

docs.lead_paragraph: To reform college sports, some educators propose acknowledging reality, and awarding academic credit for playing and a curriculum built around the sport.
docs.abstract: Some college officials have proposed college majors based around sports, since varsity athletes are often completely immersed in their sport and put little time into academics; educators David Pargman, William D Coplin and Josephine T Potuto debate advantages and drawbacks of idea.
docs.snippet: To reform college sports, some educators propose acknowledging reality, and awarding academic credit for playing and a curriculum built around the sport.
